subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Help getting software
msgSnippet: I m not sure how you have set up your TeX installation, but you should be able to use both side by side. I m a big fan of texlive, it takes care of all the
messageBody:
I'm not sure how you have set up your TeX installation, but you should
be able to use both side by side.
I'm a big fan of texlive, it takes care of all the installation details
for you, but I'm not certain how mac friendly it is.

There's no space set aside for QS yet, but there's an encoding in the
private use area which works reasonably well.

I use plain text and HTML myself, it isn't the best solution but anyone
who I'm likely to share files with will probably have a suitable font.

Paul Tremblay wrote:
>
> Thanks. I'll try installing that version of TeX, though that means
> overwriting a perfectly good version. What do you use to write
> documents? Also, I see that there is a Unicode proposal, but right now
> there is no Unicode set aside for Quickscript, is there?
>
> Paul
>
>
